page.title: 05Disused Gravel Pits.
page.content: During the past 30 years gravel has been extracted from the area. The gravel is now worked out and the pits have become full of water and formed several small lakes. The ownership is shared by Surrey County Council and private companies. The largest lake is used for wind-surfing and boating. Others are stocked for fishing, namely carp, tench, roach, rudd and perch. There is also a trout pond. Permits are issued annually and the facilities provided attract enthusiasts from all over the South-East.
